Title: Employment Agreement
Description: Formal contract outlining job role, responsibilities, salary, and terms of employment.
Template:
**EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Employment Agreement ("Agreement") is made and entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

[COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS] ("Company");

and

[EMPLOYEE NAME], an individual with an address at [ADDRESS] ("Employee").

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

The Company and the Employee desire to enter into this Agreement to establish the terms and conditions of the Employee's employment by the Company.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions shall apply:

*   "Company Property" means all property, tangible and intangible, owned or used by the Company, including but not limited to trade secrets, confidential information, and intellectual property.
*   "Confidential Information" means all information, whether written or oral, that is not generally known to the public and that relates to the Company's business, operations, or affairs.
*   "Intellectual Property" means all patents, trademarks, copyrights, and other forms of intellectual property owned or used by the Company.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Employee agrees to:

*   Perform the duties and responsibilities of the [ROLE / POSITION] as set forth in this Agreement;
*   Maintain the confidentiality of all Company Property and Confidential Information;
*   Not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company;
*   Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and Company policies.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company agrees to:

*   Provide the Employee with a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's payroll policies;
*   Provide the Employee with all necessary equipment, tools, and resources to perform the duties and responsibilities of the [ROLE / POSITION];
*   Maintain the Employee's confidentiality and protect the Employee's rights under applicable laws.

The Employee agrees to:

*   Maintain the confidentiality of all Company Property and Confidential Information;
*   Not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company;
*   Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and Company policies.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Company shall pay the Employee a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's payroll policies. The Employee shall be entitled to [NUMBER] days of paid vacation per year, paid in accordance with the Company's vacation policies.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee agrees to maintain the confidentiality of all Company Property and Confidential Information. The Employee acknowledges that the Company's intellectual property, including but not limited to trade secrets and confidential information, is valuable and shall be protected by law.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years. Upon expiration of the initial term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive one-year periods unless either party gives written notice of termination at least [NUMBER] days prior to the end of the then-current term.

Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party. Upon termination, the Employee shall return all Company Property and Confidential Information to the Company.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [STATE/COUNTRY]. Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Any notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**COMPANY**

Signature: _____________________________
Name: _______________________________
Title: _______________________________
Date: _______________________________

**EMPLOYEE**

Signature: _____________________________
Name: _______________________________
Date: _______________________________

Title: Offer Letter
Description: Initial job offer with compensation, title, and conditions — typically signed before full contract.
Template:
**OFFER LETTER**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Offer Letter ("Agreement") is made and entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

[COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS] ("Company")

and

[EMPLOYEE NAME], an individual with an address at [ADDRESS] ("Employee")

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

Recitals:

* The Company is engaged in the [INDUSTRY/FIELD] industry and is seeking to employ the Employee as [ROLE/POSITION].
* The Employee has been selected for this position based on their qualifications and experience.
* The Company is willing to offer the Employee the position and compensation set forth in this Agreement.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions shall apply:

* "Company" shall mean [COMPANY NAME] and its affiliates.
* "Employee" shall mean [EMPLOYEE NAME].
* "Effective Date" shall mean the date of this Agreement.
* "Term" shall mean the period of time during which the Employee shall perform the duties and services required of them under this Agreement.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Employee shall:

* Perform the duties and services required of them under this Agreement;
* Work at the Company's principal place of business or at such other location as the Company may designate;
* Maintain the confidentiality of all Company information and trade secrets;
* Comply with all applicable laws and regulations.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company shall:

* Provide the Employee with a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's regular payroll schedule;
* Provide the Employee with [NUMBER] days of paid vacation per year;
* Provide the Employee with [NUMBER] days of paid sick leave per year;
* Maintain the Employee's benefits, including health insurance and retirement plans.

The Employee shall:

* Perform the duties and services required of them under this Agreement;
* Maintain the confidentiality of all Company information and trade secrets;
* Comply with all applicable laws and regulations.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Company shall pay the Employee a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's regular payroll schedule. The Employee shall receive [NUMBER] days of paid vacation per year and [NUMBER] days of paid sick leave per year.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee shall maintain the confidentiality of all Company information and trade secrets, including but not limited to:

* All proprietary information and trade secrets;
* All confidential and proprietary documents and materials;
* All information related to the Company's business and operations.

The Employee shall not disclose any such information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years.

Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].

Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either party may give notice to the other party in writing, delivered by hand, email, or certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

This Agreement has been executed by the parties as of the date first above written.

[COMPANY NAME]

By: _____________________________

Title: _____________________________

[EMPLOYEE NAME]

By: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

Title: Employee Handbook
Description: A go-to guide for company culture, policies, code of conduct, leave, benefits, etc.
Template:
**EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK CONTRACT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Employee Handbook Contract ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company")
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Employee")

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

The Company and the Employee desire to establish a mutually beneficial employment relationship. The Employee agrees to work for the Company in the capacity of [ROLE / POSITION] and to comply with the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions shall apply:

*   **"Company Property"** means all property, tangible and intangible, owned or controlled by the Company, including but not limited to trade secrets, confidential information, and intellectual property.
*   **"Confidential Information"** means all information, whether written or oral, that is not generally known to the public and that is disclosed by the Company to the Employee, including but not limited to trade secrets, business strategies, and customer lists.
*   **"Intellectual Property"** means all patents, trademarks, copyrights, and other forms of intellectual property owned or controlled by the Company.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Employee agrees to:

*   Work for the Company in good faith and to the best of their ability
*   Comply with all laws, regulations, and Company policies
*   Maintain the confidentiality of Company Property and Confidential Information
*   Not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company
*   Not use any Company Property or Confidential Information for any purpose other than in the performance of their duties
*   Not engage in any activity that is detrimental to the Company or its interests

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company agrees to:

*   Provide the Employee with a safe and healthy work environment
*   Pay the Employee a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid bi-weekly
*   Provide the Employee with all necessary equipment and resources to perform their duties
*   Comply with all applicable laws and regulations

The Employee agrees to:

*   Perform their duties to the best of their ability
*   Maintain the confidentiality of Company Property and Confidential Information
*   Not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company
*   Not use any Company Property or Confidential Information for any purpose other than in the performance of their duties

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Company shall pay the Employee a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid bi-weekly. The Employee shall be eligible for [list any benefits, such as vacation time, sick leave, etc.].

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee agrees to maintain the confidentiality of Company Property and Confidential Information. The Employee acknowledges that they have been entrusted with confidential information and that they shall not disclose such information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years. Upon expiration of the term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for an additional [CONTRACT DURATION] years, unless either party gives written notice of termination at least [NUMBER] days prior to the expiration of the term.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION]. Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either party may give notice to the other party in writing, delivered by hand, email, or certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Date: __________________________________

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

Title: Independent Contractor Agreement
Description: For freelancers and consultants — defines scope, pay, deliverables, and IP ownership.
Template:
**INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Independent Contractor Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company"), with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Independent Contractor"), with an address at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

The Company and the Independent Contractor agree to the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement, which will govern the Independent Contractor's work on the Company's projects.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement:

*   "Project" means the specific project or task assigned to the Independent Contractor by the Company.
*   "Work" means the services performed by the Independent Contractor under this Agreement.
*   "Intellectual Property" means all intellectual property rights, including but not limited to patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Independent Contractor agrees to:

*   Perform the Work in accordance with the Company's instructions and requirements.
*   Maintain the confidentiality of the Company's trade secrets and Intellectual Property.
*   Comply with all applicable laws and regulations.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company agrees to:

*   Provide the Independent Contractor with a clear description of the Project and the Work to be performed.
*   Pay the Independent Contractor according to the terms set forth in Section 6.

The Independent Contractor agrees to:

*   Provide the Company with high-quality Work.
*   Maintain the confidentiality of the Company's trade secrets and Intellectual Property.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Company shall pay the Independent Contractor a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per [ROLE / POSITION] for the duration of the Contract. The Independent Contractor shall be entitled to receive payment for the Work performed, as set forth in the Company's invoice.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Independent Contractor agrees to:

*   Maintain the confidentiality of the Company's trade secrets and Intellectual Property.
*   Not disclose any confidential information to any third party.

The Company agrees to:

*   Own all Intellectual Property created by the Independent Contractor during the term of this Agreement.
*   Grant the Independent Contractor a non-exclusive license to use the Intellectual Property for the purpose of this Agreement.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] months.

Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].

Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either party may give notice to the other party in writing, delivered by hand, email, or certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

---

**COMPANY NAME:** \[COMPANY NAME]

**EMPLOYEE NAME:** \[EMPLOYEE NAME]

**DATE:** \[DATE]

**ROLE / POSITION:** \[ROLE / POSITION]

**SALARY AMOUNT:** \[SALARY AMOUNT]

**CONTRACT DURATION:** \[CONTRACT DURATION] months

**LOCATION:** \[LOCATION]

**JURISDICTION:** \[JURISDICTION]

**INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DETAILS:** \[INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY DETAILS]

**GOVERNING LAW:** \[GOVERNING LAW]

**DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS:** \[DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS]

Title: Internship Agreement
Description: Used when hiring interns — clarifies learning expectations, mentorship, and compensation.
Template:
**INTERNSHIP AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Internship Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company"), with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Intern"), with a mailing address at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

2.1 The Company is a [TYPE OF COMPANY] with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS].
2.2 The Intern is a student/individual seeking to gain work experience in [FIELD/INDUSTRY].
2.3 The Company is seeking to provide the Intern with work experience and training in [ROLE/POSITION].

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions shall apply:

*   "Internship" means the work experience and training provided by the Company to the Intern.
*   "Company Property" means all property, including but not limited to documents, equipment, and intellectual property, owned or controlled by the Company.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

4.1 The Intern shall devote [NUMBER] hours per week to the Internship for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] weeks, commencing on [START DATE] and ending on [TERMINATION DATE].
4.2 The Intern shall perform the duties and tasks as outlined in the Company's [PROJECT/PROJECTS] and shall work under the supervision of [SUPERVISOR'S NAME].
4.3 The Intern shall maintain the confidentiality of all Company Property and shall not disclose any confidential information to any third party.
4.4 The Intern shall not engage in any business or professional activity that competes with the Company's business.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

5.1 The Intern shall:

*   Provide accurate and complete information about their qualifications and experience.
*   Comply with all applicable laws and regulations.
*   Maintain the confidentiality of all Company Property.
*   Not disclose any confidential information to any third party.

5.2 The Company shall:

*   Provide the Intern with a safe and healthy work environment.
*   Provide the Intern with training and guidance in their role.
*   Pay the Intern a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per week.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

6.1 The Company shall pay the Intern a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per week, paid bi-weekly.
6.2 The Intern shall receive [NUMBER] days of paid vacation time during the contract duration.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

7.1 The Intern shall maintain the confidentiality of all Company Property and shall not disclose any confidential information to any third party.
7.2 The Intern shall not use any Company Property for any purpose other than the performance of the Internship.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

8.1 The term of this Agreement shall commence on [START DATE] and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] weeks, unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Section.
8.2 Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

9.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].
9.2 Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

10.1 Any notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**COMPANY SIGNATURE**

Date: __________________________________

**INTERN SIGNATURE**

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

Title: Remote Work Policy
Description: Defines rules and expectations for working from home or other remote locations.
Template:
**REMOTE WORK POLICY CONTRACT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

* **Title:** Remote Work Policy Agreement
* **Parties:**
	+ [COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
	+ [EMPLOYEE NAME], an individual with a residence at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

* The parties acknowledge that [COMPANY NAME] offers remote work opportunities to its employees, and this Remote Work Policy Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into to govern the terms and conditions of such remote work arrangements.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

* For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions apply:
	+ "Remote Work" means working from a location outside of the company's primary office, including but not limited to home, coffee shop, or co-working space.
	+ "Company Property" means all company materials, equipment, and intellectual property.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

* The employee agrees to work remotely in accordance with the following terms and conditions:
	+ The employee will maintain a dedicated workspace that is free from distractions and interruptions.
	+ The employee will ensure that all work-related activities are conducted in a professional and respectful manner.
	+ The employee will comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and company policies while working remotely.
	+ The employee will maintain confidentiality of all company information and intellectual property.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

* **[COMPANY NAME] Obligations:**
	+ Provide the employee with a remote work arrangement, including but not limited to a laptop, internet access, and necessary software.
	+ Ensure that the employee has access to all necessary company resources and information.
* **[EMPLOYEE NAME] Obligations:**
	+ Perform work duties in a professional and efficient manner while working remotely.
	+ Maintain regular working hours and be available during core working hours.
	+ Comply with all company policies and procedures.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

* The employee will receive a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per [ROLE / POSITION] per [CONTRACT DURATION] period, paid in accordance with the company's standard payroll schedule.
* The employee will be eligible for [list any additional benefits, such as bonuses or stock options].

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

* The employee agrees to maintain the confidentiality of all company information and intellectual property, including but not limited to trade secrets, customer lists, and proprietary software.
* The employee acknowledges that all company materials, equipment, and intellectual property are the property of [COMPANY NAME] and will not be used for personal gain or benefit.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

* The term of this Agreement will commence on [EFFECTIVE DATE] and will continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] months/years, subject to renewal or termination as agreed upon by the parties.
* Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

* This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].
* Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement will be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS], including but not limited to arbitration or mediation.

**10. NOTICES**

* Any notices or communications required or permitted to be given under this Agreement will be in writing and will be delivered personally, by email, or by certified mail, return receipt requested.
* Notices will be deemed to have been given when delivered personally, or five (5) days after being sent by email, or upon receipt of certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

* By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
* [COMPANY NAME] Representative: _____________________________
* [EMPLOYEE NAME] Representative: _____________________________

**DATE:** [DATE]

**LOCATION:** [LOCATION]

**TERMINATION DATE:** [TERMINATION DATE]

Title: Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)
Description: Protects confidential company info when shared with employees, interns, or vendors.
Template:
**NON-DISCLOSURE AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Non-Disclosure Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company"), with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Employee"), with an address at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

The Company and the Employee are parties to a [ROLE / POSITION] relationship, and the Employee has access to confidential and proprietary information of the Company ("Confidential Information").

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement:

*   "Confidential Information" means all information, whether written or oral, that is not generally known to the public and that relates to the Company's business, products, services, technology, or trade secrets.
*   "Intellectual Property" means all patents, trademarks, copyrights, trade secrets, and other forms of intellectual property owned or controlled by the Company.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Employee agrees to:

*   Keep confidential all Confidential Information received from the Company, and not disclose it to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.
*   Use the Confidential Information solely for the purpose of performing the Employee's duties and not for any other purpose.
*   Not reproduce, copy, or distribute the Confidential Information in any form or medium.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company agrees to:

*   Provide the Employee with access to Confidential Information necessary for the Employee to perform the Employee's duties.
*   Ensure that the Employee is aware of the confidential nature of the Confidential Information.

The Employee agrees to:

*   Cooperate with the Company in maintaining the confidentiality of the Confidential Information.
*   Return all Confidential Information to the Company upon termination of the Employee's employment or relationship.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Employee shall receive a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's standard payroll practices.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee acknowledges that the Confidential Information is the Company's exclusive property and that the Employee has no right, title, or interest in such information.

The Employee agrees not to:

*   Use the Confidential Information for any purpose other than performing the Employee's duties.
*   Disclose the Confidential Information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.
*   Create any derivative works or copies of the Confidential Information.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years.

Upon termination of this Agreement, the Employee shall:

*   Return all Confidential Information to the Company.
*   Destroy all copies of the Confidential Information.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].

Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either party may give notice to the other party in writing, delivered by hand, email, or certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

---

**EMPLOYEE NAME:** _______________________________________
**DATE:** _______________________________________________

Title: Invention Assignment Agreement
Description: Ensures any work or IP created on the job belongs to the company.
Template:
**INVENTION ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Invention Assignment Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company"), with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Employee"), with an address at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

2.1 The Employee is an employee of the Company and has been assigned to work on various projects, including the development of inventions and intellectual property ("IP").

2.2 The Employee has created or will create IP during the term of this Agreement, including but not limited to inventions, trade secrets, and other intellectual property.

2.3 The Company desires to acquire the rights to the IP created by the Employee during the term of this Agreement.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions shall apply:

*   "IP" means all inventions, trade secrets, and other intellectual property created by the Employee during the term of this Agreement.
*   "Invention" means any new and useful process, machine, manufacture, or composition of matter, or any improvement thereof.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

4.1 The Employee assigns, transfers, and conveys to the Company all right, title, and interest in and to the IP created by the Employee during the term of this Agreement.

4.2 The Employee shall not, during the term of this Agreement, disclose or reveal any information regarding the IP to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.

4.3 The Employee shall not, during the term of this Agreement, create or develop any IP that is substantially similar to any IP already owned by the Company.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

5.1 The Employee shall use all reasonable efforts to create and develop IP during the term of this Agreement.

5.2 The Company shall provide the Employee with access to all necessary resources and information to enable the Employee to create and develop IP.

5.3 The Company shall pay the Employee a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's regular payroll practices.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

6.1 The Company shall pay the Employee a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's regular payroll practices.

6.2 The Company shall also pay the Employee any additional compensation or bonuses in accordance with the Company's regular practices.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

7.1 The Employee shall keep confidential all information regarding the IP, including but not limited to trade secrets and other confidential information.

7.2 The Employee shall not, during the term of this Agreement, disclose or reveal any information regarding the IP to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.

7.3 The Company shall own all rights, title, and interest in and to the IP created by the Employee during the term of this Agreement.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

8.1 The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years.

8.2 Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

8.3 Upon termination of this Agreement, the Employee shall return all IP to the Company and shall not disclose or reveal any information regarding the IP to any third party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

9.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].

9.2 Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

10.1 Any notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.

10.2 Any notice shall be deemed to have been given when it is personally delivered or when it is sent by certified mail or email.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**COMPANY SIGNATURE**

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

**EMPLOYEE SIGNATURE**

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

Title: Data Protection & Privacy Consent Form
Description: Employees acknowledge how their data is handled and company confidentiality rules.
Template:
**DATA PROTECTION & PRIVACY CONSENT FORM**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Data Protection & Privacy Consent Form ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company")
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Employee")

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

The Company is committed to protecting the personal data and privacy of its employees. This Agreement is entered into to acknowledge the Company's data protection policies and procedures, and to confirm the Employee's consent to the handling of their personal data.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement:

*   "Personal Data" means any information relating to an individual, whether written or electronic, including but not limited to name, address, date of birth, and employment details.
*   "Confidential Information" means any information that is not generally known to the public and that is not publicly available, including but not limited to trade secrets, business strategies, and employee information.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Employee acknowledges that:

*   The Company will collect, store, and process the Employee's Personal Data in accordance with applicable data protection laws and regulations.
*   The Company will use the Employee's Personal Data for the purposes of employment, including but not limited to payroll, benefits, and performance management.
*   The Employee's Personal Data will be kept confidential and will not be disclosed to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.
*   The Employee acknowledges that they have read and understood the Company's data protection policies and procedures, and that they consent to the handling of their Personal Data.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company shall:

*   Ensure that all employees are aware of and comply with the Company's data protection policies and procedures.
*   Take all necessary steps to protect the Employee's Personal Data from unauthorized access, disclosure, or loss.

The Employee shall:

*   Provide the Company with accurate and up-to-date Personal Data.
*   Cooperate with the Company in the implementation of its data protection policies and procedures.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Employee shall receive a salary of [SALARY AMOUNT] per annum, paid in accordance with the Company's payroll policies and procedures.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee acknowledges that:

*   The Company's confidential information is proprietary and confidential, and that the Employee shall not disclose or use such information without the prior written consent of the Company.
*   The Employee acknowledges that they have not used or disclosed any confidential information prior to the Effective Date.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue in effect for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] months. Upon expiration of the initial term, this Agreement shall automatically renew for successive periods of [CONTRACT DURATION] months, unless terminated by either party with [NUMBER] days' written notice.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION]. Any disputes arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either party may give notice to the other party in writing, delivered by hand or by registered mail, sent to the address specified in Section 1.1.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read and understood the terms and conditions of this Agreement, and that they consent to the handling of their Personal Data.

**EMPLOYEE SIGNATURE**

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

**COMPANY SIGNATURE**

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

Title: Equity/Stock Option Grant Agreement (ESOP)
Description: Outlines vesting, cliff, and terms of employee share options.
Template:
**EQUITY/STOCK OPTION GRANT AGREEMENT (ESOP)**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

* **1.1** This Equity/Stock Option Grant Agreement (the "Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] (the "Effective Date") by and between:
	+ [COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS] (the "Company");
	+ [EMPLOYEE NAME], an individual with an address at [ADDRESS] (the "Grantee");
* **1.2** The Company and the Grantee are collectively referred to as the "Parties".

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

* **2.1** The Company desires to attract and retain top talent, and to incentivize the Grantee's contributions to the Company.
* **2.2** The Grantee is willing to accept the grant of equity/stock options by the Company, as set forth in this Agreement.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

* **3.1** The following definitions are applicable to this Agreement:
	+ "Option" means the equity/stock options granted to the Grantee under this Agreement.
	+ "Vesting Period" means the period during which the Grantee's Option will vest, as set forth in Section 4.1.
	+ "Cliff Period" means the period during which the Grantee's Option will not vest, as set forth in Section 4.2.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

* **4.1** Vesting Period: The Grantee's Option will vest [NUMBER]% each [NUMBER] months, commencing on the [DATE] (the "Vesting Start Date").
* **4.2** Cliff Period: The Grantee's Option will not vest until the end of the [NUMBER] month period following the Vesting Start Date.
* **4.3** Option Exercise: The Grantee may exercise the Option by delivering a written notice to the Company, specifying the number of shares to be exercised.
* **4.4** Option Price: The Option Price will be [PRICE] per share, as determined by the Company.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

* **5.1** The Company's Obligations:
	+ The Company will issue the Grantee's Option to the Grantee, as set forth in this Agreement.
	+ The Company will pay the Option Price to the Grantee, as set forth in Section 6.1.
* **5.2** The Grantee's Obligations:
	+ The Grantee will use the Option to purchase shares of the Company's common stock (the "Shares") for the benefit of the Grantee.
	+ The Grantee will comply with all applicable laws and regulations.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

* **6.1** Option Price: The Company will pay the Option Price to the Grantee, as set forth in this Agreement.
* **6.2** Vesting Schedule: The Grantee's Option will vest in accordance with the Vesting Period, as set forth in Section 4.1.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

* **7.1** Confidentiality: The Parties agree to maintain the confidentiality of all information disclosed in connection with this Agreement.
* **7.2** Intellectual Property: The Grantee acknowledges that the Option is an intellectual property right granted by the Company, and that the Grantee will not infringe on the Company's intellectual property rights.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

* **8.1** Term: The term of this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and will continue until the termination of the Grantee's employment with the Company.
* **8.2** Termination: This Agreement may be terminated by either Party upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other Party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

* **9.1** Governing Law: This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [STATE/COUNTRY].
* **9.2** Jurisdiction: Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement will be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

* **10.1** Notice: Any notices or communications required or permitted to be given under this Agreement will be in writing and will be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.

**11. SIGNATURES**

* **11.1** Execution: This Agreement has been executed by the Parties as of the date first above written.
* **11.2** Signatures:
	+ [COMPANY NAME]
	+ [EMPLOYEE NAME]

Title: Employee Shareholder Agreement
Description: Used when employees hold actual shares rather than just options.
Template:
**EMPLOYEE SHAREHOLDER AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Employee Shareholder Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

* [COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS] ("Company")
* [EMPLOYEE NAME], an individual with an address at [ADDRESS] ("Employee")

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

Recitals:

* The Company and the Employee are parties to a [EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT/CONTRACT] dated [DATE] ("Employment Agreement").
* The Employee is granted [NUMBER] shares of [COMPANY NAME] stock ("Shares") under the terms of the Employment Agreement.
* The Employee desires to acquire actual ownership of the Shares and to be recognized as a shareholder of the Company.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

For the purposes of this Agreement:

* "Shares" means the [NUMBER] shares of [COMPANY NAME] stock granted to the Employee under the Employment Agreement.
* "Company" means [COMPANY NAME] and its successors and assigns.
* "Employee" means [EMPLOYEE NAME] and their successors and assigns.
* "Effective Date" means the date of this Agreement.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

4.1. **Ownership of Shares**

The Employee shall have the right to purchase and own the Shares, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

4.2. **Voting Rights**

The Employee shall have the right to vote the Shares in accordance with the Company's bylaws and applicable law.

4.3. **Transferability**

The Shares shall be transferable by the Employee to the Company upon termination of this Agreement.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

5.1. **Employee Obligations**

The Employee shall:

* Hold the Shares in their own name and not in the name of any other person or entity.
* Use the Shares for no other purpose than to benefit the Company.
* Not transfer or assign the Shares to any other person or entity without the prior written consent of the Company.

5.2. **Company Obligations**

The Company shall:

* Deliver the Shares to the Employee upon payment of the purchase price.
* Register the Shares in the Employee's name on the Company's stock records.
* Provide the Employee with a copy of the Company's bylaws and applicable law.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

6.1. **Purchase Price**

The Employee shall pay the purchase price of the Shares in accordance with the terms of the Employment Agreement.

6.2. **Payment Schedule**

The Employee shall make payments of the purchase price in [NUMBER] installments of [AMOUNT] due on [DATE].

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

7.1. **Confidentiality**

The Employee shall keep confidential all information and materials provided by the Company, including but not limited to trade secrets and proprietary information.

7.2. **Intellectual Property**

The Employee shall not use the Company's intellectual property, including but not limited to trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets, without the prior written consent of the Company.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

8.1. **Term**

The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years.

8.2. **Termination**

Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

9.1. **Governing Law**

This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [STATE/COUNTRY].

9.2. **Jurisdiction**

Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

10.1. **Notice Requirements**

Any notices or communications required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by facsimile transmission.

10.2. **Notice Address**

The address for notice purposes shall be [ADDRESS].

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**COMPANY**

[COMPANY NAME]

By: _____________________________

Title: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

**EMPLOYEE**

[EMPLOYEE NAME]

By: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

**IN WITNESS WHEREOF**

The parties have executed this Agreement as of the date first above written.

[COMPANY NAME]

[EMPLOYEE NAME]

Title: Create Stock Option Plan (Master Scheme)
Description: Sets up the full ESOP structure, approved by the board and/or shareholders.
Template:
**CREATE STOCK OPTION PLAN (MASTER SCHEME)**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

* **Title:** Create Stock Option Plan (Master Scheme)
* **Parties:**
	+ [COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation (the "Company")
	+ [EMPLOYEE NAME], an employee of the Company (the "Employee")

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

* The Company desires to attract and retain top talent by offering stock options to its employees.
* The Employee has been employed by the Company for [LENGTH OF EMPLOYMENT] and has demonstrated exceptional performance and dedication.
* The Company wishes to establish a stock option plan to incentivize the Employee's continued service and to align the Employee's interests with those of the Company.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

* For the purposes of this Plan, the following definitions shall apply:
	+ "Option Grant Date" means the date on which the Employee is granted the stock options under this Plan.
	+ "Vesting Period" means the period during which the Employee's stock options vest.
	+ "Exercise Price" means the price at which the Employee may exercise the stock options under this Plan.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

* The Company shall grant to the Employee [NUMBER] stock options to purchase [NUMBER] shares of [COMPANY NAME] stock (the "Stock Options").
* The Stock Options shall vest [VESTING PERIOD] days after the Option Grant Date, subject to the Employee's continued service to the Company.
* The Employee shall have the right to exercise the Stock Options at any time after the Vesting Period has ended.
* The Exercise Price shall be [EXERCISE PRICE] per share.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

* **Company Obligations:**
	+ The Company shall issue the Stock Options to the Employee upon the Vesting Period.
	+ The Company shall maintain the Employee's stock options in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
* **Employee Obligations:**
	+ The Employee shall not assign or transfer the Stock Options to any third party.
	+ The Employee shall use the Stock Options for the Employee's personal benefit only.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

* The Employee shall receive [SALARY AMOUNT] per year as compensation for the Employee's services to the Company.
* The Employee shall be eligible to receive additional compensation in the form of stock options or other forms of compensation as determined by the Company.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

* The Employee shall maintain the confidentiality of all Company information and trade secrets.
* The Employee shall not disclose any confidential information to any third party without the prior written consent of the Company.
* The Employee acknowledges that the Stock Options are subject to the Company's intellectual property policies and shall comply with such policies.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

* The term of this Plan shall commence on the Option Grant Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years.
* Upon termination of the Employee's employment with the Company, the Employee shall return all Company property, including but not limited to, any Company documents or materials.
* The Company may terminate this Plan at any time upon written notice to the Employee.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

* This Plan shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [STATE/COUNTRY].
* Any disputes arising out of or related to this Plan shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

* Any notices required or permitted to be given under this Plan shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email to the address specified below:
	+ [COMPANY NAME]
	+ [ADDRESS]
	+ [EMAIL ADDRESS]
	+ [PHONE NUMBER]

**11. SIGNATURES**

* By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Plan.
* [COMPANY NAME]
	+ [EXECUTIVE NAME]
	+ [TITLE]
	+ [DATE]
* [EMPLOYEE NAME]
	+ [EMPLOYEE SIGNATURE]
	+ [DATE]

Title: Founder Vesting Agreement
Description: Prevents early founders from leaving with full equity before delivering long-term value.
Template:
**FOUNDER VESTING AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Founder Vesting Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company"), a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Founder"), an individual with an address at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

Recitals:

*   The Company and the Founder are parties to a [ARTICLE/SECTION] of the Company's [ARTICLE/SECTION] that provides for the vesting of [NUMBER]% of the Company's outstanding shares of [SHARE CLASS] ("Shares") to the Founder upon the Founder's continued service to the Company.
*   The Founder has agreed to vest in the Shares in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions shall apply:

*   "Vesting Period" means the period during which the Founder's Shares vest, as set forth in Section 4.
*   "Vesting Schedule" means the schedule set forth in Section 4, which outlines the percentage of Shares that vest to the Founder during the Vesting Period.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The terms and conditions of this Agreement are as follows:

*   The Founder shall vest in the Shares in accordance with the Vesting Schedule, which provides for the following vesting schedule:
    *   [VESTING SCHEDULE]
*   The Founder shall not be entitled to any payment or compensation in connection with the vesting of the Shares, except as provided in Section 6.
*   The Founder shall not be entitled to any benefits or perks in connection with the vesting of the Shares, except as provided in Section 7.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The obligations of each party are as follows:

*   The Company shall vest the Shares to the Founder in accordance with the Vesting Schedule.
*   The Founder shall continue to serve the Company in good faith and in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The payment or compensation terms of this Agreement are as follows:

*   The Founder shall not be entitled to any payment or compensation in connection with the vesting of the Shares, except as provided in this Section.
*   The Company shall pay the Founder a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid in accordance with the Company's regular payroll schedule.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The confidentiality and intellectual property terms of this Agreement are as follows:

*   The Founder shall keep confidential all information and materials provided to the Founder by the Company, including but not limited to trade secrets and confidential business information.
*   The Founder shall not use or disclose any confidential information or materials provided to the Founder by the Company, except as provided in this Section.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term and termination of this Agreement are as follows:

*   The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue for a period of [CONTRACT DURATION] years.
*   Upon termination of this Agreement, the Founder shall return all Company property, including but not limited to Shares, to the Company.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

The governing law and jurisdiction of this Agreement are as follows:

*   This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [STATE/COUNTRY].
*   Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through arbitration in accordance with the rules of the [ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION].

**10. NOTICES**

The notice terms of this Agreement are as follows:

*   Any notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.
*   Any notice given under this Agreement shall be deemed to have been given when it is delivered personally, or when it is sent by certified mail, or when it is sent by email.

**11. SIGNATURES**

This Agreement has been executed by the parties as of the date first above written.

**[COMPANY NAME]**

By: _____________________________

Title: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

**[EMPLOYEE NAME]**

By: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

Title: Joint Share Ownership Agreement (JSOP)

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

* **Parties:** [COMPANY NAME] and [EMPLOYEE NAME] (collectively, the "Parties")
* **Date:** [EFFECTIVE DATE]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

* The Parties desire to establish a Joint Share Ownership Agreement (the "Agreement") to govern the co-ownership of [COMPANY NAME] shares by the Parties.
* The Parties acknowledge that they have the authority to enter into this Agreement and that it is not contrary to any other agreement or understanding between the Parties.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

	+ "Employee" means [EMPLOYEE NAME].

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

* Upon termination of this Agreement, the Parties shall return all Company property, including but not limited to Shares and confidential information.

* Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

* Any notices required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.
* Any notice shall be deemed to have been given when it is personally delivered or when it is sent by certified mail or email, as evidenced by the return receipt or delivery confirmation.

Title: Workplace Code of Conduct
Description: Defines acceptable behavior, ethical standards, anti-harassment, etc.
Template:
**WORKPLACE CODE OF CONDUCT CONTRACT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Workplace Code of Conduct Contract ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

*   **[COMPANY NAME]** ("Company"), with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS]
*   **[EMPLOYEE NAME]** ("Employee"), with their address at [ADDRESS]

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

The Company and Employee desire to establish a positive and productive work environment, free from harassment, discrimination, and other forms of misconduct. This Agreement outlines the expectations and standards of behavior for Employee while working for the Company.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions apply:

*   **"Company Property"** means all property, materials, and equipment owned or controlled by the Company, including but not limited to documents, software, and equipment.
*   **"Confidential Information"** means all information, whether written or oral, that is not generally known to the public and is not publicly available, including but not limited to trade secrets, business strategies, and customer information.
*   **"Harassment"** means any unwelcome or uninvited behavior, including but not limited to verbal or physical conduct, that creates a hostile or intimidating work environment.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Employee agrees to:

*   Maintain the highest standards of professionalism, integrity, and respect in all interactions with colleagues, customers, and the public.
*   Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and Company policies.
*   Refrain from engaging in any form of harassment, bullying, or discriminatory behavior.
*   Protect and respect the Company Property and Confidential Information.
*   Maintain confidentiality of all information related to the Company's business, customers, and employees.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Company agrees to:

*   Provide a safe and healthy work environment.
*   Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards.
*   Provide reasonable accommodations for Employee's needs.

The Employee agrees to:

*   Perform their duties to the best of their ability.
*   Maintain confidentiality of all information related to the Company's business, customers, and employees.
*   Comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and Company policies.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Employee will receive a salary of $[SALARY AMOUNT] per year, paid bi-weekly, commencing on [START DATE]. The Employee will also be eligible for [BENEFITS OR PERKS].

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee agrees to:

*   Maintain confidentiality of all information related to the Company's business, customers, and employees.
*   Protect and respect the Company Property and Confidential Information.
*   Not disclose any Confidential Information to any third party without prior written consent from the Company.

The Company agrees to:

*   Own and retain all intellectual property rights to all work created by Employee while working for the Company.
*   Provide reasonable compensation and benefits to Employee for their work.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The term of this Agreement will commence on [START DATE] and will continue in effect until [TERMINATION DATE]. Either party may terminate this Agreement upon [NUMBER] days' written notice to the other party.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION]. Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement will be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either party may give notice to the other party in writing, delivered by hand, email, or certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**COMPANY SIGNATURE**

Date: __________________________________

**EMPLOYEE SIGNATURE**

Signature: _____________________________
Date: __________________________________

**GRIEVANCE POLICY & COMPLAINT FORM**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

* **This Grievance Policy and Complaint Form** ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between [COMPANY NAME] ("Company") and [EMPLOYEE NAME] ("Employee").
* The parties agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

* The Company is committed to maintaining a safe and respectful work environment for all employees.
* The Employee has concerns regarding [SPECIFY CONCERN OR ISSUE].
* The Company is willing to address the Employee's concerns and provide a resolution.

**3. DEFINITIONS (IF APPLICABLE)**

* For the purposes of this Agreement, the following definitions apply:
	+ "Complaint" means a written or verbal report of a concern or issue by an Employee to the Company.
	+ "Grievance" means a formal complaint filed by an Employee with the Company.
	+ "Investigation" means the process by which the Company reviews and addresses a Complaint or Grievance.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

* The Employee shall report any concerns or issues to the Company in writing or verbally, using the attached Complaint Form.
* The Company shall investigate all Complaints and Grievances in a fair and timely manner.
* The Company shall respond to the Employee within [TIMEFRAME, e.g., 5 business days] of receiving the Complaint or Grievance.
* The Company shall provide a written response to the Employee, including a resolution or explanation of the actions taken.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

* **Employee:**
	+ Shall report all concerns or issues to the Company in writing or verbally, using the attached Complaint Form.
	+ Shall cooperate with the Company's investigation and provide any requested information or documentation.
* **Company:**
	+ Shall investigate all Complaints and Grievances in a fair and timely manner.
	+ Shall respond to the Employee within [TIMEFRAME, e.g., 5 business days] of receiving the Complaint or Grievance.
	+ Shall provide a written response to the Employee, including a resolution or explanation of the actions taken.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

* The Company shall not make any payment or offer any compensation to the Employee as a result of this Agreement.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

* The Employee shall maintain the confidentiality of all information disclosed to the Company in connection with this Agreement.
* The Company shall own and retain all intellectual property rights to any information or materials provided by the Employee in connection with this Agreement.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

* This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue in effect until [TERMINATION DATE] or until terminated by either party with [NUMBER] days' written notice.
* Upon termination, the Employee shall return all Company property, including but not limited to documents and equipment.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

* This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION].
* Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS, e.g., arbitration].

Title: Termination of Employment Letter
Description: Formal notice outlining reasons, notice period, and next steps.
Template:
**TERMINATION OF EMPLOYMENT LETTER**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Termination of Employment Letter ("Letter") is made and entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

[COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS] ("Company");

and

[EMPLOYEE NAME], an individual with an address at [ADDRESS] ("Employee");

collectively referred to as the "Parties".

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

WHEREAS, the Company and the Employee have entered into an Employment Agreement dated [DATE OF EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT] ("Agreement") for the Employee's employment by the Company; and

WHEREAS, the Employee has been employed by the Company in the capacity of [ROLE / POSITION] since [DATE OF HIRE] ("Employment Period");

WHEREAS, the Company and the Employee have discussed the Employee's performance and the Company's needs, and have agreed that the Employee's services are no longer required; and

WHEREAS, the Company wishes to terminate the Employee's employment under the Agreement.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Letter, the following definitions shall apply:

* "Agreement" means the Employment Agreement dated [DATE OF EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT] between the Company and the Employee.
* "Company Property" means all property, including but not limited to trade secrets, confidential information, and intellectual property, owned or controlled by the Company.
* "Employee Property" means all property, including but not limited to trade secrets, confidential information, and intellectual property, owned or controlled by the Employee.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

The Company and the Employee agree as follows:

* The Employee's employment under the Agreement shall terminate on [TERMINATION DATE] ("Termination Date");
* The Employee shall return all Company Property to the Company on or before the Termination Date;
* The Employee shall not disclose any confidential information or trade secrets of the Company to any third party;
* The Employee shall not use any Company Property for any purpose other than as authorized by the Agreement.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

The Parties agree as follows:

* The Company shall pay the Employee's salary in accordance with the Agreement until the Termination Date;
* The Employee shall not be entitled to any additional compensation or benefits after the Termination Date.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

The Company shall pay the Employee's salary in accordance with the Agreement until the Termination Date. The Employee shall not be entitled to any additional compensation or benefits after the Termination Date.

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

The Employee acknowledges that the Company's confidential information and trade secrets are proprietary and confidential, and shall not disclose such information to any third party. The Employee also acknowledges that the Company's intellectual property, including but not limited to patents, trademarks, and copyrights, are proprietary and confidential, and shall not use or disclose such intellectual property without the Company's prior written consent.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

The Employment Period shall terminate on the Termination Date. The Termination Date shall be considered the final day of employment for the Employee.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

This Letter shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of [JURISDICTION]. Any disputes arising out of or related to this Letter shall be resolved through [DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCESS].

**10. NOTICES**

Either Party may give notice to the other Party in writing, delivered by hand, email, or certified mail, return receipt requested. Such notice shall be deemed to have been given when delivered personally, or five (5) days after mailing by certified mail, return receipt requested.

**11. SIGNATURES**

This Letter has been executed by the Parties as of the date first above written.

**[COMPANY NAME]**

By: _____________________________

Title: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

**[EMPLOYEE NAME]**

By: _____________________________

Date: _____________________________

Title: Severance Agreement
Description: Outlines exit package, benefits, waivers, and legal protection on both sides.
Template:
**SEVERANCE AGREEMENT**

**1. TITLE AND PARTIES**

This Severance Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on [EFFECTIVE DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between:

[COMPANY NAME], a [STATE/COUNTRY] corporation with its principal place of business at [ADDRESS] ("Company");

and

[EMPLOYEE NAME], an employee of Company with the address at [ADDRESS] ("Employee");

collectively referred to as the "Parties".

**2. RECITALS / BACKGROUND**

WHEREAS, the Company and the Employee have been parties to an employment agreement dated [DATE OF EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT] ("Employment Agreement"); and

WHEREAS, the Employee has been employed by the Company in the capacity of [ROLE / POSITION] since [DATE OF HIRE] ("Employment Period");

WHEREAS, the Company and the Employee desire to enter into this Agreement to provide the Employee with a severance package in exchange for the Employee's agreement to certain conditions.

**3. DEFINITIONS**

For the purposes of this Agreement:

* "Company Property" means all property, tangible and intangible, of the Company, including but not limited to trade secrets, confidential information, and intellectual property.
* "Severance Package" means the payment and benefits provided to the Employee under this Agreement.
* "Termination Date" means the date on which the Employee's employment with the Company terminates, as specified in Section 8.

**4. TERMS AND CONDITIONS**

4.1 **Severance Package**: The Company agrees to provide the Employee with a severance package consisting of:

* A payment of [SALARY AMOUNT] in a single lump sum payment;
* [NUMBER] weeks of severance pay, calculated at [RATE] per week, for a total of [TOTAL SEVERANCE PAY] dollars;
* [NUMBER] days of accrued but unused vacation time, paid out in accordance with the Company's vacation policy;
* Reimbursement for [NUMBER] of [TYPE] of expenses incurred by the Employee during the Employment Period.

4.2 **Waivers**: The Employee agrees to waive any and all claims, demands, or causes of action against the Company, its officers, directors, employees, and agents, arising out of or related to the Employee's employment with the Company.

**5. OBLIGATIONS OF EACH PARTY**

5.1 **Employee Obligations**: The Employee agrees to:

* Return all Company Property to the Company upon request;
* Not disclose any confidential or proprietary information of the Company to any third party;
* Not use any confidential or proprietary information of the Company for any purpose other than as required by the Employment Agreement.

5.2 **Company Obligations**: The Company agrees to:

* Provide the Employee with the Severance Package as set forth in Section 4.1;
* Pay all taxes and other expenses related to the Severance Package.

**6. PAYMENT OR COMPENSATION TERMS**

6.1 **Payment**: The Company shall pay the Employee the Severance Package in accordance with Section 4.1.

6.2 **Payment Schedule**: The payment shall be made as follows:

* [SALARY AMOUNT] on [DATE];
* [TOTAL SEVERANCE PAY] in [NUMBER] installments of [INSTALLMENT AMOUNT] each, on [DATE].

**7. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY**

7.1 **Confidentiality**: The Employee agrees to keep confidential all confidential or proprietary information of the Company, including but not limited to trade secrets and intellectual property.

7.2 **Intellectual Property**: The Employee acknowledges that all intellectual property rights in and to the Company Property are owned by the Company, and that the Employee has no right, title, or interest in such property.

**8. TERM AND TERMINATION**

8.1 **Term**: The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall continue until the Termination Date.

8.2 **Termination**: The Employee's employment with the Company shall terminate upon the occurrence of any of the following events:

* The Employee's voluntary resignation;
* The Company's termination of the Employee's employment;
* The Employee's death or disability.

**9. GOVERNING LAW AND JURISDICTION**

9.1 **Governing Law**: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the [STATE/COUNTRY].

9.2 **Jurisdiction**: Any disputes arising out of or related to this Agreement shall be resolved through binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the [ARBITRATION ASSOCIATION].

**10. NOTICES**

10.1 **Notice**: Any notice or communication required or permitted to be given under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be delivered personally, by certified mail, or by email.

10.2 **Address**: The address for notice shall be [ADDRESS].

**11. SIGNATURES**

By signing below, the Parties acknowledge that they have read, understand, and agree to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

**COMPANY**

[Signature]
[Name]
[Title]
[Date]

**EMPLOYEE**

[Signature]
[Name]
[Date]
